result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Eric Arthur Rhodes was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Eric Arthur Rhodes in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Riek states defendant trying to get into VA court in Dane County.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct 1, Ct 2 and civil citations dismissed. Court accepted plea, adjudged guilty, JOC entered.   Court withheld sentence and placed on 2 years probation.  Conditions:  120 days jail with huber commencing  11-7-16 @ 7 pm.  May transfer to Dane County. May serve with electronic monitoring.   Good time allowed.  , Fine $2502.00 to probation.  48 month revocation/48 month interlock upon licensure, AODA and comply.  $87.00 Blood Draw Reimbursement Fee.  Submit DNA sample/$250 surcharge.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  4 days jail credit.
